snippet: The demonstrators were supporters of the government, but angry that security forces did not prevent the attacks on a school that killed several dozen children in the Akrama district.
abstract: Protesters in Homs, Syria, demand ouster of provincial governor and post images of their demonstrations on social media; demonstrators are supporters of the government, but angry that security forces did not prevent bombings at school that killed several dozen children in the Akrama district.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and MOHAMMAD GHANNAM
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The demonstrators were supporters of the government, but angry that security forces did not prevent the attacks on a school that killed several dozen children in the Akrama district.

headline.main: Protests Erupt in Homs Over Bombings That Killed Dozens of Syrian Schoolchildren
headline.print_headline: Protests Erupt in Homs Over Bombings That Killed Dozens of Syrian Schoolchildren
